page.title: 10Place Names in Our Area
page.content: OLTON means Â£Old Town' and refers to ULVERLEY which is mentioned in the Domesday Book meaning Wulferes clearing Ulverley became known as Â£old town' after the development of the Â£new town' of SOLIHULL.The name YARDLEY dates back to 972 when it was known as Gyrdleahe meaning stick clearing or yard. In the Domesday Book it had been renamed Gerlei. SHELDON takes its name from De' Scheldon, the Lord of the Manor whilst ACOCKS GREEN is named after farmer John Acock. CHAPELFIELDS FARM was a Tudor farmhouse which stood on the site of a former chapel until its demolition in 1954. GILBERTSTONE refers to Â£The Gilbertstone', a parish boundary.It takes its name from the Gilbard family living in the area in the 13th century. The name LYNDON first occurs in 1221 with a Lyndon Manor in existence in the 15th century.
